results.title: Pride and diversity
results.brief_description: ‘Pride and Diversity’ was a program of digital storytelling workshops with multiple groups focussed on community issues and cultural diversity. In partnership with VicHealth, City of Stonington, City of Melbourne, Kensington Association, Kensington Women’s Dinner, Kensington Storytelling Festival ‘ community storytellers, Quiksound Productions- City of Monash FReeZA committee, Minus 18, Inside Out Group, Pride & Diversity group- Monash Youth & Family Services, Roleplay, Soundslike ‘ City of Stonington’s FreeZA committee, Go Girl Go, Young Mum’s program, The Club, Girls Own - YWCA

results.brief_description: A meditation on the importance of being true to oneself. Made as part of the ‘Pride and Diversity’ workshop in association with Vic Health.

results.title: The Sound of Hip Hop
results.brief_description: Karim, a music teacher who works in Kensington with African youth, relates how he first discovered Hip Hop and started his love affair with music. Created as part of the ‘Kensington Stories’ ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with the Kensington Storytelling Festival and in partnership with VicHealth.

results.title: My inspiration
results.brief_description: In this short, the narrator tells us how her son provides her with daily inspiration to live a good life. Made as part of the ‘Pride and Diversity’ workshop in association with Vic Health.

results.title: The World's greatest freak show
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow, Stephen Bosustow Productions and Xerox Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Desire to read”.
A cartoon adventure designed to develop reading skills by visualising book materials. Presents the story of a man who in his efforts to obtain riches, exploits freaks for theatrical purposes. Based on the picture book by Ellen Raskin. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: The Seventh mandarin
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Desire to read”.
Long ago in a walled palace lived a Chiense emperor, guarded and guided by seven assistants called mandarins. None of them ever set foot outside the palace and they knew nothing of the people until the seventh and youngest mandarin ventured out one night…Based on the picture book by Jane Yolen.

results.title: The Peasant's pea patch: a Russian folk tale
results.creator_credit: Nick Bosustow, Stephen Bosustow Productions and Xerox Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Desire to read”.
This tall tale from Russian folklore follows the hilarious misadventures of a Russian peasant who tries in vain to protect his pea patch from a flock of hungry cranes. The film ends with the defeated peasant illustrating that, although life can be difficult, humanity somehow manages not only to survive but to survive in good spirit.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Nick Bosustow, Stephen Bosustow Productions and Xerox Films

results.title: First rock
results.brief_description: The narrator tells us about her ‘first ever gig, first ever band’ in this humourous digital story. Made as part of ‘Pride and Diversity’ workshop in association with Vic Health.

results.title: The Day
results.brief_description: This storyteller talks about the devastating day that she lost the most important person in her life - her Nan. Made as part of the “Pride and Diversity” workshop in association with Vic Health.

results.title: Dave's story
results.brief_description: In this short monologue the narrator reveals a crucial moment in his young life - when his high school teacher revealed the secret to happiness. Made as part of the ‘Pride and Diversity’ workshop in association with Vic Health.
